action.primary: Clears Heat, cools the Blood and reduces toxicity

indications: Snakebites and wasp and bee stings (internally and topically) This is the herb of choice

contraindications: This herb can cause loose stools and anorexia when decocted.
Contraindicated for those with edema due to Deficiency.
Contraindicated for those with Blood Deficiency.
interactions: Concurrent use with diuretics such as chlorothiazide, hydrochlorothiazide, furmoside (Lasix), bumetinide (Bumex) and torsemide (Demadex) may lead to increased elimination of water and/or electrolytes.

useCases: Strongly facilitates the removal of pathogenic water to treat edema associated with end-stage schistosomiasis

notes: One source lists this as a Heat Clearing Herb.
Some sources say that this herb calms dyspnea.
This herb can be used alone both Internally and topically for insect or snake bites.
It has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
This herb is said to treat tumor, hepatitis, appendicitis, ascites due to cirrhosis and pulmonary abscess.
It has shown to be effective in treating esophageal, gastric and uterine cancers.

Both Ban Bian Lian and Hb. Hedyotis Diffusae #{BaiHuaSheSheCao} Bai Hua She She Cao facilitate the removal of pathogenic water, reduce edema, clear Heat and resolve toxicity. Ban Bian Lian is a stronger diuretic while Bai Hua She She Cao is stronger at cooling and removing Damp-Heat and is preferred in the treatment of painful urinary dysfunction.
